data.title: King, Jones, Carter, Beardmore and Carter- In Their Own Write
data.text:
DETAILS AND REGISTRATION:

In Their Own Write is being launched at The National Archives in London, UK.

The event is free but registration is required.

Registration and more details here:

https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/in-their-own-write-teaching-the-voices-of-the-victorian-poor-tickets-529113993197

Location: The National Archives, Bessant Drive, Kew, TW9 4DU, United Kingdom

This event is in collaboration with Nottingham Trent University and The National Archives. Project funded by The Arts and Humanities Research Council.

Steven King is professor of economic and social history at Nottingham Trent University and the author of Writing the Lives of the English Poor, 1750s-1830s.

Paul Carter is principal records specialist (Modern Domestic), Collaborative Projects at The National Archives.

Natalie Carter is a visiting fellow at Nottingham Trent University.

Peter Jones is senior research associate at the University of Glasgow.

Carol Beardmore is lecturer in history at the Open University.

about the book
